Key Match Events: Pakistan defeated South Africa by 33 runs in the 2022 T20I World Cup match at Sydney.
Pakistan scored 185 runs after losing 9 wickets.
South African batters made a slow start, and post rains the wickets kept on falling, leading to a 33 run victory for Pakistan.
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 41 runs.
Shaheen Shah Afridi took 3 wickets for 14 runs.
Shadab Khan was announced the Player of the Match for his all-round performance.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam at the toss: 'We will bat. Put runs on the board and then place them under pressure in the chase. We will try and give our best and then move forward. One change for us - Fakhar misses out, Haris is in.'

Temba Bavuma at the toss: 'We would have batted first as well, looks a bit dry, but there is some green. Batting first is an advantage, but we need to keep them down to a low score and then chase well. We have a great bunch of guys and have derived a lot of support and confidence from them. Two changes for us - one is a forced one with Miller missing out with an injury, Klaasen replaces him. Shamsi is in, he replaces Keshav Maharaj.'
Post-Match Reflections: Harsha Bhogle praised Shadab Khan and the Pakistani cricket team, stating that this performance is the reason why many considered Pakistan as one of the contenders.
Former cricketer Alan Wilkins applauded the performance of team Pakistan and praised Shadab Khan's performance.
Robin Uthappa praised the Pakistani players for their victory.
Mohammad Hafeez congratulated team Pakistan and applauded Shadab Khan and Iftikhar Ahmed for their remarkable performance.
Pakistan's skipper, Babar Azam, expressed his joy over the victory and mentioned that Haris helped the team in maintaining momentum.
Shadab Khan mentioned that his performance in this international game was the best one and praised the pitch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The DLS method was used as rain intervened the match.
Pakistan's victory kept their T20 World Cup dream alive.
The match was delayed due to rain, and the game was shortened to 14 overs with a new target of 142 runs for South Africa.
